title: Can't Login
body:
I will pull up the patcher and try to login when I get an server or connection error. I tried all the fixes the league website gave and eventually checked my League Log to find all this garbage: 

000002.418|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "BugSplatRc.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.529|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "ffmpegsumo.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.574|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "icui18n.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.617|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "icuuc.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.661|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "jpatch.exe" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.820|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "libcef.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.855|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "libEGL.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000002.897|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "libGLESv2.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.226|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "LoLPatcher.exe" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.379|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "LoLPatcherUx.exe" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.525|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "rgDownload_R.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.561|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "RiotGridLoad.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.636|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "RiotLauncher.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.
000003.689|   WARN| Riot::RADS::Patching::UpdateAndInstallShared::DoesFileExistWithCorrectMD5: "v8.dll" (0.0.0.81) exists, but failed the MD5 check.

So yeah, any idea on how to fix it? I've tried the DNS, Force Re-patch and Uninstalling and Reinstalling and none of them have worked.

replies.body: Alright so I'm pretty sure I tried everything, so I got some yellow and red flags when I took the packet loss test. The red flags had to do with the DNS returning addresses that weren't actually there and the yellow flag stuff had to do with some kind of FTP Proxy thing. So any advice on how to not use this proxy? I know the guide said to make sure that we aren't using proxies so

Unfortunately, those logs aren't telling me a lot and it's not really clear what you mean regarding the sites you used to troubleshoot.  Can you paint me another picture with some more details like the specific error you're getting and when exactly it's happening?  Is this on the updated or legacy client?  Is there a specific % it happens?  Let me know.
Also the client I originally used was the updated client and the error occurred after the authentication process; it happened every time I tried to login.

Thanks for this info!  Unless your hard drive is out of space, getting an error at 60% suggests a network problem.  More specifically, your connection is too weak and backtracking so it can't download the game files without having hiccups.  My suggestion would be to over each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help troubleshoot.  This isn't an issue with your IE or browser, but how your connection is reaching the patching server.  Let me know if that clears things up!

I just used the league forum with the general fixes where it says to check Internet Explorer offline mode, the DNS settings and so on. I didn't write down the exact error and I cannot replicate it because I can no longer download the game. Every time I tried to login it didn't work, and every time I try to re-download the game it gives me "Unspecified error" about 60% of the way through the download. I used the Hextech Repair Tool to do a clean uninstall and it still didn't work
